title: Arjuna's Dilemma
summary: Arjuna faces a moral crisis on the battlefield, torn between duty and compassion.

title: The Path of Knowledge
summary: Krishna introduces the concept of the eternal soul and the path of wisdom.

title: The Path of Action
summary: The importance of selfless action and doing one's duty without attachment to results.

title: The Path of Wisdom
summary: Krishna explains the nature of action, knowledge, and the ancient tradition of yoga.

title: Action and Renunciation
summary: The relationship between action and renunciation, and the path to liberation.

title: The Path of Meditation
summary: Instructions on meditation, self-control, and achieving inner peace.

title: Knowledge and Wisdom
summary: Understanding the divine nature and the difference between knowledge and wisdom.

title: The Eternal Brahman
summary: The imperishable nature of the Supreme and remembering God at the time of death.

title: Royal Knowledge
summary: The most secret and royal knowledge about devotion and divine manifestation.

title: Divine Manifestations
summary: Krishna describes his divine manifestations and glories in the world.

title: The Universal Form
summary: Arjuna witnesses Krishna's cosmic form, seeing the entire universe within him.

title: The Path of Devotion
summary: The qualities of a true devotee and the path of loving devotion to God.

title: Field and Knower
summary: Understanding the body as the field and the soul as the knower of the field.

title: Three Qualities of Nature
summary: The three modes of material nature: goodness, passion, and ignorance.

title: The Supreme Person
summary: Krishna as the Supreme Person, beyond both the perishable and imperishable.

title: Divine and Demonic Natures
summary: The distinction between divine and demonic qualities in human nature.

title: Three Types of Faith
summary: How the three modes of nature influence faith, worship, and lifestyle.

title: Liberation Through Renunciation
summary: The conclusion: the path to liberation through renunciation and surrender to God.
